title: Space Exploration Missions
description: Milestones in space travel and exploration

questions.question: Which Soviet cosmonaut became the first human in space on April 12, 1961?
Apollo 11 successfully landed on the Moon in 1969. Who was the first person to set foot on the lunar surface?
Which NASA space telescope, launched in 1990, has provided some of the most detailed images of distant galaxies?
The Voyager 1 spacecraft, launched in 1977, became the first human-made object to enter what region of space?
Which space station, operated by the Soviet Union, was the first modular space station and orbited from 1986 to 2001?
The Challenger disaster of January 1986 occurred how long after the Space Shuttle launched?
Which Mars rover, active from 2004 to 2018, far exceeded its planned 90-day mission?
Who was the first American woman in space, flying aboard the Space Shuttle Challenger in 1983?
The International Space Station (ISS) has been continuously occupied by astronauts since which year?
Apollo 13, the 'successful failure,' experienced an oxygen tank explosion in which year?
The Cassini spacecraft spent 13 years studying which planet and its rings before plunging into its atmosphere in 2017?
Which was the first American satellite launched into orbit in January 1958?
Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, was launched by which country in October 1957?
The New Horizons spacecraft provided the first close-up images of which dwarf planet in 2015?
Which astronaut holds the record for spending the most total time in space among American astronauts, with 665 days?
